thread.title: Illini guard Kendrick Nunn out eight weeks with thumb injury - Chicago Tribune
thread.title_full: Illini guard Kendrick Nunn out eight weeks with thumb injury - Chicago Tribune

author: Shannon Ryan
title: Illini guard Kendrick Nunn out eight weeks with thumb injury - Chicago Tribune
text:
Illinois guard Kendrick Nunn will miss eight weeks with a left thumb injury, an Illinois sports information spokesperson confirmed.
Nunn injured his thumb last week at a preseason practice. According to a tweet by CBSSports.com, he will undergo surgery on Wednesday.
Add Nunn to a list that includes point guard Tracy Abrams (out for the season with an Achilles injury), forward Leron Black (out four to six weeks with a knee injury), freshman guard Jalen Coleman-Lands (slated for a Nov. 1 return from a stress fracture in a leg) and guard Jaylon Tate (out with a concussion).
